questions.text: Which of the following respiratory system components is derived from neural crest?

Wrong match about the bone and cartilages in pharyngeal arches

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Third arch: Lesser cornu of hyoid bone

questions.text: Artery lying deep to marked area in the given Pic is branch of which of the following artery.?

1- year-old male is found to have high blood pressure, normal genitalia on physical examination, low serum aldosterone and high serum testosterone. Which of the following is most likely to be elevated in this patient?
Which of the following is a correct description of connections involving cerebellar neurons?

options.label: A
options.text: Basket cells release glutamate to activate Purkinje cells.

options.label: B
options.text: Climbing fiber inputs exert a strong excitatory effect on Purkinje cells, and mossy fiber inputs exert a weak excitatory effect on Purkinje cells.

options.label: C
options.text: Granule cells release glutamate to excite basket cells and stellate cells.

options.label: D
options.text: The axons of Purkinje cells are the sole output of the cerebellar cortex, and they release glutamate to excite the deep cerebellar nuclei.

questions.correct_answer: B. Climbing fiber inputs exert a strong excitatory effect on Purkinje cells, and mossy fiber inputs exert a weak excitatory effect on Purkinje cells.

A drug follows first order kinetic of excretion, shows a half-life of 6 hours. How much of the drug remains after 24 hours?
A patient develops torsades de pointes after starting a new antiarrhythmic. Which class is implicated?

A 58-year-old man with congestive heart failure is being treated with furosemide for volume overload. On follow-up, he complains of muscle weakness and cramps. Blood tests reveal hypokalemia. Which of the following agents, when added to his regimen, would best help prevent further potassium loss?

A 32-year-old man with schizophrenia is being considered for antipsychotic therapy. His treating physician is particularly concerned about the risk of extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS), given the patient's history of movement disorders. Which of the following antipsychotic medications is associated with the lowest risk of developing EPS?

A 7-year-old child is brought to the clinic with complaints of frequent episodes of sudden staring, lip smacking, and brief unresponsiveness lasting for a few seconds. The EEG reveals 3-Hz spike-and-wave discharges. Which of the following is the preferred drug for treatment in this case?

A young woman diagnosed with an uncomplicated urinary tract infection was started on empirical antibiotic therapy. After a few days, she reports heel pain and difficulty walking. On examination, tenderness is noted over the Achilles tendon, raising suspicion of tendinitis. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of the most likely causative antibiotic?

A patient undergoing chemotherapy for breast cancer develops symptoms of ringing in the ears, along with decreased urine output . Which of the following agents is used as a cytoprotective antidote to prevent renal damage associated with this anticancer drug?
A neutropenic patient with fever is started on amphotericin B. What is the major limiting toxicity?

A 45-year-old male renal transplant recipient presents with progressive gingival overgrowth and increased serum creatinine levels during a routine follow-up. His immunosuppressive regimen includes a calcineurin inhibitor, an antiproliferative agent, and low-dose corticosteroids. He denies nonadherence. Which of the following drugs in his regimen is most likely responsible for both his current findings?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Other options analysis- A. Azathioprine – Bone marrow suppression; not associated with nephrotoxicity or gum changes B. Mycophenolate – GI side effects, bone marrow suppression; no gingival hyperplasia or nephrotoxicity D. Tacrolimus – Causes nephrotoxicity, tremor, hyperglycemia; no gum hypertrophy

questions.text: A researcher is studying the bacterial growth curve of Escherichia coli. During which phase of growth are antibiotics targeting cell wall synthesis most effective?

A patient receives a kidney transplant and experiences hyperacute rejection within minutes. Which of the following mechanisms is responsible?
questions.correct_answer: A. Preformed antibodies against donor antigens

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with high fever, abdominal pain, and diarrhea after eating improperly cooked chicken. Stool culture reveals Gram-negative, non-lactose fermenting, H2S-producing rods. What is the causative organism?

A 30-year-old man presents with high fever, jaundice, and conjunctival suffusion. He recently swam in floodwater. Laboratory findings show elevated creatinine, bilirubin, and transaminases. Which of the following is the most likely selective medium for this pathogen?

A 70-year-old nursing home resident develops pneumonia with productive sputum. Gram stain of the sputum reveals Gram-negative coccobacilli. The bacteria grow on chocolate agar but not on MacConkey agar. What is the most likely causative organism?

A 25-year-old woman presents with cyclical fevers, chills, and headaches after returning from a trip to rural village. Blood smear shown in the image. What stage of the parasite’s life cycle is responsible for clinical symptoms?

A 30-year-old man presents with seizures and brain cysts. CT shows multiple calcified lesions with cystic areas. Serology is positive for Taenia solium. How did the patient most likely acquire this infection?

questions.text: A 25-year-old man presents with fever, headache, and photophobia. On examination, he has neck stiffness and a positive Kernig's sign. He is drowsy but arousable. Fundoscopy shows papilledema. What is the next best step?

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. Perform brain imaging before LP

questions.text: A 40-year-old alcoholic presents with burning pain and numbness in both feet. Examination reveals decreased vibration and pinprick sensation in a stocking distribution, and absent ankle jerks. Which nerve fibers are most involved?
questions.correct_answer: D. Both small and large fibers

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with ptosis and diplopia that worsens by evening. No limb weakness is present. Tensilon test is positive. Which test is most specific to confirm the diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male with known heart failure (EF 30%) presents with increasing dyspnea and bilateral leg swelling. BP is 100/60 mmHg, JVP is elevated, bilateral crepitations are present. Which medication should be avoided in this patient during decompensation?

A 28-year-old woman with a mid-diastolic murmur at the apex and variable S1intensity presents with worsening dyspnea and palpitations. ECG shows atrial fibrillation. Which valvular lesion is most likely?
A 60-year-old man with right heart failure has elevated JVP with a prominent "v" wave and absent x descent. Which is the most likely cause?

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • A. Morphine and nitrates: Symptomatic, not definitive
  • • • B. Heparin: Adjunct therapy
  • • • C. Beta-blockers: Avoided acutely in hemodynamic instability

questions.text: A 50-year-old male presents with hypotension, muffled heart sounds, and elevated JVP. ECG shows low voltage and electrical alternans. What is the most immediate step?
A 35-year-old man is found to have BP of 180/110 mmHg on multiple readings. He has episodes of palpitations, headache, and sweating. ECG is normal. What is the most appropriate next step?

A 76-year-old male with a history of hypertension and CAD presents with palpitations and light-headedness. ECG shows wide complex tachycardia at 180 bpm with fusion beats. BP is 110/70 mmHg. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 26-year-old trauma patient presents with hypotension, cold clammy skin, and tachycardia. Neck veins are flat. Extremities are cold. Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure is low. What is the most likely type of shock?

A 40-year-old vegetarian woman presents with fatigue and pallor. CBC shows Hb 8 g/dL, MCV 110 fL. Peripheral smear shows hypersegmented neutrophils. Serum methylmalonic acid is elevated. What is the likely cause?
A 70-year-old male with COPD on home oxygen presents with confusion. ABG: pH 7.32, paCO₂ 60 mmHg, HCO₃⁻ 32 mEq/L. What is the primary acid-base disturbance?
questions.correct_answer: B. Respiratory acidosis with metabolic compensation

questions.text: A 3-year-old child from a low-income area presents with bleeding gums, irritability, and swollen knees. On exam, there is perifollicular hemorrhage and corkscrew hairs. What is the most likely deficiency?

A 55-year-old male with chronic alcoholism presents with weakness, confusion, and tremors. Lab values: Na⁺ 136, K⁺ 3.2, Mg²⁺ 0.6 mg/dL. ECG shows prolonged QT interval. Which electrolyte abnormality must be corrected first to prevent refractory hypokalemia?

A 40-year-old woman complains of heat intolerance, palpitations, and weight loss. On exam, she has tachycardia and a non-tender, enlarged thyroid. TSH is undetectable, and free T4 is elevated. Radioiodine uptake scan shows diffuse increased uptake. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old woman has symmetric joint pain in the hands and morning stiffness lasting over an hour. RF is positive. Anti-CCP is also positive. Which of the following features best differentiates rheumatoid arthritis from systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)?
questions.correct_answer: C. Erosive joint changes on X-ray

questions.text: A 25-year-old man presents with fever, headache, and a maculopapular rash involving palms and soles. He recently returned from a trekking trip. He has tender regional lymphadenopathy and eschar. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 48-year-old man with a history of alcohol use presents with jaundice and abdominal distension. Lab results show: AST 145 IU/L, ALT 62 IU/L, ALP 150 IU/L, total bilirubin 6.2 mg/dL, INR 1.9, and low albumin. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old man with diabetes presents with edema and frothy urine.BP is 120/80 mmHg.Investigations: proteinuria 5.8 g/day, hypoalbuminemia, normal creatinine. Which renal biopsy finding is most likely?

options.label: D

questions.text: A 28-year-old man presents with hemoptysis, cough, and hematuria. Chest X-ray shows bilateral alveolar infiltrates. Renal biopsy shows linear IgG deposition along the GBM. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 67-year-old man presents with fatigue and weight loss. CBC: Hb 9 g/dL, WBC 160,000 with left shift, and platelets 450,000. LAP score is low. BCR-ABL fusion gene is positive. What is the diagnosis?

A 48-year-old woman with progressive breathlessness is found to have the following PFT results: • FEV 1 : 70% predicted • FVC: 68% predicted • FEV 1 / FVC: 0.88 • TLC: reduced • DLCO: markedly reduced What is the most likely cause?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • • Restrictive pattern = ↓ TLC + normal or ↑ 1FEV 1 / FVC
  • • • DLCO markedly reduced → suggests interstitial lung disease, like IPF
  • • • Myasthenia would also show restriction, but DLCO is usually normal or mildly reduced
  • • Rule-outs:
  • • • A. Asthma & C. COPD: Both are obstructive
  • • • D. Myasthenia gravis: Restrictive pattern but DLCO is preserved

questions.text: The court has decided that the accused needs psychiatric evaluation. Many Discrepancies were noted between the statements told in the court and to the doctor. The suspicion should point max toward?
Which of the following is not a component of polysomnography assessment?

A 29-year-old man is brought to the emergency room by his wife after he woke up with paralysis of his right arm. The patient reports that the day before, he had gotten into a verbal altercation with his mother over her intrusiveness in his life. The patient notes that he has always had mixed feelings about his mother, but that people should always respect their mothers above all else. Which of the following diagnoses best fits this patient’s clinical picture?

The mother of a 25-year-old man who was diagnosed with AIDS 1 year ago, reports that her son had been doing well until this morning when she observed him sitting up in bed, punching the air and grabbing at insects, although none were present. The patient’s CD4 count is < 100 cells/mm3 and his temperature is 103°F. The mother is concerned about these symptoms because the patient’s elder brother has schizophrenia. This clinical picture is most consistent with:
questions.correct_answer: B. Delirium caused by cryptococcal meningitis

questions.text: Arrange the following Cardinal movements in Labour in proper sequence: 1. Engagement 2. External rotation 3. Crowning 4. Internal rotation 5. Extension
A rhesus-negative second para has an antibody titre of 4 IU/ml (ICT 1:4) at 8 weeks. Her husband is homozygous rhesus positive. What is the next step in the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Assess middle cerebral artery blood flow from 18 weeks.

options.label: B
options.text: Assess the amniotic fluid bilirubin levels at 18 weeks.

options.label: C
options.text: Determine the fetal rhesus status by cordocentesis

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat the antibody titre in 4 weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. Repeat the antibody titre in 4 weeks

questions.text: At 32 years old G3P2L2 with mitral stenosis of severe type, has 38 weeks of gestation and active labour. Her LVEF is 25% and she has class 4 NYHA breathlessness. The foetus is in cephalic presentation. There is no foetal distress and there is no cpd. What should be the appropriate line of management in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Give her epidural analgesia and augment labour by oxytocin

options.label: B
options.text: Do not allow vaginal delivery and do caesarean section

options.label: C
options.text: Give her TOCOLYTICS and correct her CCF

options.label: D
options.text: Give her epidural analgesia and watch for progress of labour on a partogram

questions.correct_answer: B. Do not allow vaginal delivery and do caesarean section

questions.text: The highest risk of congenital varicella syndrome in pregnancy is seen during which phase of pregnancy?
Identify the given congenital anomaly shown in ultrasound:
Calculate the expected due date of a patient who underwent IVF and embryo transfer was done on 21st of January 2025. Her embryo was transferred in day 5 stage.
Identify the incorrect pair-

A primipara is in the 2nd stage of labour for three hours. She is getting 4 contractions per 10 minutes. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats per minute and regular. On vaginal examination, the head is just above the level of the ischial spines with the sagittal suture in the transverse diameter of pelvis, with a caput and grade 3 moulding. The spines are prominent. The estimated fetal weight is 3.2kg. What is the best treatment option?

options.label: A
options.text: Wait for one hour for spontaneous rotation of the head and normal delivery.

options.label: B
options.text: Manually rotate the head and apply forceps.

questions.correct_answer: C. Perform a caesarean section immediately.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most common cause of antepartum haemorrhage?
Which one of the following is not seen in a case of gestational hypertension?

At 33 years old G3A2 with 16 weeks of gestation has presence of anti-cardiolipin antibody which was confirmed two times 12 weeks apart. She has history of foetal deaths at 12 weeks of gestations. What is an appropriate management in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Give her aspirin and heparin throughout pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Terminate this pregnancy due to risk of congenital malformations

options.label: D
options.text: Check for the presence of lupus anticoagulant and anti-B2 glycoprotein-1 antibody and only if one of these two antibodies is present then give aspirin plus heparin therapy.

questions.correct_answer: A. Give her aspirin and heparin throughout pregnancy

questions.text: At 27 years old primigravida developed breathlessness, chest pain and shock immediately after delivery. There was no visible vaginal bleeding in this case. Uterus was firm in consistency. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?
Which one of the following is not a reason of increased AFP in maternal serum?
Which one of the following is a Feature of anthropoid pelvis?

options.label: A
options.text: The inlet of the pelvis is kidney shaped

options.label: B
options.text: It is antero-posteriorly oval throughout the pelvis

questions.text: According to the latest WH O’s labour care guide the plotting of partogram must begin from?
Identify the incorrect pair:

options.label: A
options.text: Uterine fundus: pre aortic lymph nodes

options.label: B
options.text: Cervix: paracervical and obturator lymph nodes

options.label: C
options.text: Cornual region of the uterus: inguinal lymph nodes

questions.text: The following picture is of cervical mucous of a fertile, ovulatory female in midcycle. It is due to:

options.label: A
options.text: NaCl in mucous due to estrogen

options.label: B
options.text: NaCl in mucous due to progesterone

questions.correct_answer: A. NaCl in mucous due to estrogen

questions.text: At 27 years old primigravida has 18 weeks of gestation. She is a known case of fibroid uterus. She has acute pain in abdomen and fever since last two days. Her WBC count is also raised. What is the likely cause of this condition?
Which one of the following is a correct pair?

options.label: D
options.text: Vesico vaginal fistula: Martius flap surgery

questions.correct_answer: B. Post-menopausal uterine prolapse: sling surgery

questions.text: Which one of the following conditions will not present as a case of menorrhagia?
Which one of the following is a cause of GnRH independent precocious puberty?

A young female presented to you with primary amenorrhoea. Examination revealed normal breast development and absent axillary hair. Pelvic examination showed vaginal opening and clitoromegaly. On ultrasound exam, gonads were visible in the inguinal region. What is the most likely diagnosis?
An 18 years old male had delayed puberty with decreased LH, FSH and testosterone levels. Which one of the following is not possible?
Which one of the following is not true about bacterial vaginosis?

options.label: A
options.text: pH is more than 4.5 with fishy foul smell.

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most important support of uterus?
What is HEADSSS used for
Which of the following is best indicator of severe HIE?
A child has 3 days of watery diarrhea, vomiting and decreased level of consciousness. All of the following are differential diagnosis except?
Out of the following, which clinical feature is not seen in Down syndrome?
A baby received BCG vaccine at birth and has been vaccinated at 14 weeks. Which of the following should be given at the next visit, and site?

options.label: A
options.text: MR s/c on left arm, and Oral vitamin A at 9 months completed

options.label: B
options.text: MR s/c on right arm, and Oral vitamin A at 9 months completed

options.label: C
options.text: MR s/c on left arm, and Oral vitamin A at 8 months completed

options.label: D
options.text: MR s/c on right arm, and Oral vitamin A at 8 months completed

questions.correct_answer: B. MR s/c on right arm, and Oral vitamin A at 9 months completed

questions.text: In sickle cell anemia, which drug is used to reduce the vaso-occlusive crisis?
Which of the following is true about congenital CMV?

options.label: A
options.text: It is most common intrauterine infection, second to syphilis

options.label: B
options.text: Blood PCR is best to diagnose within 2-3 weeks of life

options.label: C
options.text: Asymptomatic patients have risk of SNHL

questions.correct_answer: C. Asymptomatic patients have risk of SNHL

questions.text: An infant has respiratory distress, high respiratory rate and scaphoid abdomen, in the emergency. What should be avoided?

A 15-year-old adolescent is brought to the emergency department for a new-onset generalized tonic-clonic seizure that occurred while asleep. She was having a sleepover party and had stayed up until 3 am. Around 7 am, her friend found her unresponsive with generalized shaking, her eyes rolled up and open, and foaming at the mouth. The event lasted approximately 2 minutes before self-resolving. On arrival at the emergency department, the girl is drowsy but arousable. She has otherwise normal neurologic findings. Her mother reports that the adolescent has had several episodes of staring spells over the past few years which she attributed to her daughter ignoring her. Over the past year, she has periodically complained of “spasms” where her hand will suddenly jump or jerk. She denies substance use, recent or intercurrent illnesses, or trauma. There is no family history of seizures. Of the following, the MOST likely diagnosis is
Of the following, the anomaly that occurs during the second half of gestation in Infant of Diabetic Mothers:

Personal monitoring of radiation is done by:
